content:
I love your approach to keeping things simple and informal! It's perfect for a family reunion where the focus is on spending quality time together and having fun. By setting up a few stations with different activities, you're giving people the freedom to choose what they want to do and when, which can help to create a relaxed and enjoyable atmosphere.

Having a potluck with a designated area for dishes is also a great idea, as it allows everyone to contribute and share their favorite foods with the group. And, of course, having plenty of drinks and snacks available is a must!

I'm curious, what's the one thing you were going to mention? You said "One thing..." and then stopped. Was there something else you wanted to add or ask about the planning process?

Also, have you thought about how you'll handle the logistics of the event, such as setup, cleanup, and supplies? Will you be recruiting volunteers from the family to help with these tasks, or do you have a plan in place for how you'll manage these details?
